name: Xtreme Xmas Lights
description:
This is Xtreme Xmas lights created by Joseph Garland.
A.K.A. @soptheturtle on twitter and itch.io
The "Let It Snow" Background Riff was written by Joseph Stierman.

Git Hub Link to code: https://github.com/soptheturtle/unity_learning/tree/master/XtremeXmasLights

=================
Goal of the game
=================
Place Christmas lights and get the best gifts from Santa by placing the most lights in the best way possible!

To play the game download the zip files and extract them. In the folder run "Xtreme Xmas Lighting.exe"

=======================
Controller Mapping
Keyboard
=======================
A Button ==> Left Ctrl (or Mouse 1)
B Button ==> Left Alt (or Mouse 2)
X Button ==> Left Shift
Y Button ==> Spacebar
Movement ==> Arrow Keys  or WASD

=======================
Controller Mapping
Xbox Controller
=======================
A Button ==> A Button
B Button ==> B Button
X Button ==> X Button
Y Button ==> Y Button
Movement ==> Left Joystick

============================
Instructions
============================
A Button ==> Place Piece
A Button (at ladder) ==> Finish Placing Lights
B Button ==> Bring Up Xmas Light Type Menu
Y Button (while in Xmas Light Menu) ==> Switch Xmas Light Type
X Button ==> View Remaining Pieces and Current Score

+1 Point: Placing an Xmas Light
+2 Additional Points: Connect Lights Precisely
-5 Points: Step on a Light Bulb
-10 Points and -10 Xmas Lights: Fall off the Roof

Alt + F4: Quit the Game

============================
Notes
============================
You have a very small cooldown between placing lights
Lights cannot be placed on top of each other, you'll have to move

Any other questions feel free to reach out to me on twitter @soptheturtle or email soptheturtle@yahoo.com. Have a nice day!

A Macintosh build will be coming soon, but probably not until after the Game Jam is over. So for now it is only Windows PC.
